radiographic_examinations.findings: Diverticulosis of the sigmoid colon with focal wall thickening of the sigmoid colon and adjacent mesenteric fat stranding. Multiple extraluminal locules of gas adjacent to the sigmoid colon, likely sequelae of micro perforation. No organizing mesenteric fluid collection or evidence of abscess. The visualized lung fields are within normal limits. No pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are normal in size and attenuation. No evidence of solid renal lesions or hydronephrosis.
